ns:common.topic.description: CMS-2 is an embedded systems programming language used by the United States Navy.It was an early attempt to develop a standardized high level computer programming language intended to improve code portability and reusability. CMS-2 was developed primarily for the US Navyâ€™s tactical data systems.\nCMS-2 was developed by Rand Corporation in the early 1970s and stands for \"Compiler Monitor System\". The name \"CMS-2\" is followed in literature by a letter designating the type of target system. For example, CMS-2M targets Navy 16-bit processors, such as the AN/AYK-14.
rdfs:label: CMS-2

ns:common.document.text: CMS-2 is an embedded systems programming language used by the United States Navy. It was developed by Rand Corporation in the early 1970s and stands for \"Compiler Monitor System\". The name \"CMS-2\" is followed in literature by a letter designating the type of target system. For example, CMS-2M targets Navy 16-bit processors, such as the AN/AYK-14.\nCMS-2 was developed at FCPCPAC (Fleet Computer Programming Center - Pacific) in San Diego, CA. It was implemented by Computer Sciences Corp. in 1968 with design assistance from Intermetrics.

ns:type.object.name: CMS-2
